alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, Elbert. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 815 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Key Creek, Agate Creek, East Bijou Creek, Hay Gulch, Wilson Creek, First Creek, Middle Bijou Creek, Rattlesnake Creek and Water Gulch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Elbert County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
